understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method named getInternodeApplicationSendQueueCapacityInBytes which returns the value of a configuration parameter named internode_application_send_queue_capacity_in_bytes.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is directly related to the configuration parameter internode_application_send_queue_capacity_in_bytes, which is used to determine the application send queue capacity in bytes for messages queued for delivery to other nodes in the cluster.

config_description: Global, per-endpoint and per-connection limits imposed on messages queued for delivery to other nodes and waiting to be processed on arrival from other nodes in the cluster.  These limits are applied to the on-wire size of the message being sent or received.  The basic per-link limit is consumed in isolation before any endpoint or global limit is imposed. Each node-pair has three links: urgent, small and large.  So any given node may have a maximum of N*3*(internode_application_send_queue_capacity_in_bytes+internode_application_receive_queue_capacity_in_bytes) messages queued without any coordination between them although in practice, with token-aware routing, only RF*tokens nodes should need to communicate with significant bandwidth.  The per-endpoint limit is imposed on all messages exceeding the per-link limit, simultaneously with the global limit, on all links to or from a single node in the cluster. The global limit is imposed on all messages exceeding the per-link limit, simultaneously with the per-endpoint limit, on all links to or from any node in the cluster.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration code retrieves the application send queue capacity in bytes. It first checks if the capacity is not null, then returns the capacity. If the capacity is null, it retrieves the capacity from the DatabaseDescriptor.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever the application needs to send messages to other nodes in the cluster. The frequency of triggering depends on the volume of messages being sent and the size of the queue capacity.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The configuration option 'internode_application_send_queue_capacity_in_bytes' sets limits on the size of messages queued for delivery to other nodes. It affects the memory usage and performance of the system, as exceeding the capacity can lead to message drops or delays in message processing.
